The ratio of the areas of two concentric circles is $ 1: 3$.  If the radius of the smaller is $ r$, then the difference between the radii is best approximated by:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 0.41r \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 0.73 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 0.75 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 0.73r \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 0.75r$
